events.name: SW_INCR
events.description: Software increment. Instruction architecturally executed (condition check pass)

events.name: L1I_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: L1 instruction cache refill. This event counts cacheable linefill requests

events.name: L1I_TLB_REFILL
events.description: L1 instruction TLB refill. This event counts refills from the main TLB. Refills that do not result in actual allocations in the instruction micro TLB, including translation faults and Compare And Swap (CAS) fails, are excluded

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: L1 data cache refill. This event counts all allocations into the L1 cache. This includes read linefills, store linefills, and prefetch linefills

events.name: L1D_CACHE
events.description: L1 data cache access. This event counts read, write and prefetch accesses to the L1 data cache. This includes non-cacheable speculative reads which do not have cacheability attributes yet. Cache Maintenance Operation (CMO) accesses are excluded

events.name: L1D_TLB_REFILL
events.description: L1 data TLB refill. This event counts all refills effectively allocated in the data micro TLB. Translation faults are not counted and this even counts without taking into account whether the MMU is enabled or not

events.name: INST_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed. This event increments for every architecturally executed instruction, including instructions that fail their condition code check

events.name: EXC_TAKEN
events.description: Exception taken. This event is set every time that an exception is executed. CCFAIL exceptions are excluded

events.name: EXC_RETURN
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, exception return. This event is set every time that an exception return is executed in ALU0. CCFAIL exceptions are excluded

events.name: CID_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, write to CONTEXTIDR

events.name: PC_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition check pass, software change of the PC. This event counts all branches taken. This excludes exception entries and debug entries

events.name: BR_IMMED_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, immediate branch. This event counts all branches decoded as immediate branches, taken or not taken. This excludes exception entries, debug entries, and CCFAIL branches

events.name: BR_RETURN_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, procedure return. This event counts the following branches: +//0 +//0-BX R14+//0 +//0 +//0-MOV PC, LR+//0 +//0 +//0-POP{+//0,PC}+//0 +//0 +//0-LDR PC, SP, #offset+//0-

events.name: BR_MIS_PRED
events.description: Mispredicted or not predicted branch speculatively executed. This event counts branches mispredicted or not predicted. It counts: +//0 Each correction to the predicted program flow that occurs because of a misprediction. +//0 Each correction to the predicted program flow that occurs because there is no prediction. +//0 Each correction that relates to instructions that the program flow prediction resources can predict

events.name: CPU_CYCLES
events.description: Cycle

events.name: BR_PRED
events.description: Predictable branch speculatively executed. This event counts all updates to the program counter, apart from exception call/return

events.name: MEM_ACCESS
events.description: Data memory access

events.name: L1I_CACHE
events.description: L1 instruction cache access. This event is incremented when an instruction fetch reads data from data RAM or buffer, and did not need a linefill. Cache maintenance operations are excluded. The fetch granularity is 128 bits

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WB
events.description: L1 data cache Write-Back. This event counts evictions caused by natural allocation, CMO, and snoops. Write streams are excluded

events.name: L2D_CACHE
events.description: L2 data cache access. This event counts data reads, instruction reads, and prefetches that hit. Snoops are not counted

events.name: L2D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: L2 data cache refill. This event counts reads and prefetches that allocate a new linefill buffer entry. The reads and prefetches that fold into a prefetch are not counted

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WB
events.description: L2 data cache Write-Back. This event counts evictions with data caused by L2 CMOs, L2 evictions, and L2 snoops. It does not count L1 snooped data, streams, and data evicted by an L1 instruction write CMO

events.name: BUS_ACCESS
events.description: Bus access. This event counts any move of data received from or sent to the SCU

events.name: INST_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed. This event counts all the instructions that go through the core rename block at each cycle. This includes instructions architecturally executed and the last micro-operation of each instruction that is not architecturally executed

events.name: TTBR_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed (condition check pass) - Write to TTBR

events.name: BUS_CYCLES
events.description: Bus cycles

events.name: CHAIN
events.description: For odd-numbered counters, increments the count by one for each overflow of the preceding even-numbered counter. For even-numbered counters, there is no increment

events.name: L1D_CACHE_ALLOCATE
events.description: Level 1 data cache allocation without refill

events.name: L2D_CACHE_ALLOCATE
events.description: Level 2 data cache allocation without refill

events.name: BR_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, branch. This event counts all branches, taken or not taken. This excludes exception entries and debug entries. In the core, an ISB is a branch and is also counted

events.name: STALL_FRONTEND
events.description: No operation issued because of the front end. The counter counts every cycle counted by the CPU_CYCLES event on which no operation was issued because there are no operations coming from the instruction side available to issue for this core. Flush windows are excluded

events.name: STALL_BACKEND
events.description: No operation issued because of the back end. The counter counts every cycle counted by the CPU_CYCLES event on which no operation was issued because the rename stage cannot accept any instructions coming from the decoder stage. Flush windows are excluded

events.name: L1D_TLB
events.description: Level 1 data TLB access. This event counts all accesses to the data micro TLB, that is load and store instructions, and speculative load and store instructions executed. This event counts without taking into account whether the MMU is enabled or not. If 2 accesses are performed at the same time, then the counter is incremented twice

events.name: L1I_TLB
events.description: Level 1 instruction TLB access. This event counts any instruction fetch that accesses the instruction micro TLB. This event does not take into account whether the MMU is enabled or not. The fetch granularity is 128 bits

events.name: L3D_CACHE_ALLOCATE
events.description: Attributable Level 3 data or unified cache allocation without refill

events.name: L3D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: Attributable Level 3 data or unified cache refill. This event counts all cacheable read transactions that return from the DSU and come from outside of the cluster

events.name: L3D_CACHE
events.description: Attributable Level 3 data or unified cache access. This event counts all cacheable read transactions that return data from the SCU, and all cache line writes into the L3 cache that do not cause a linefill

events.name: L2D_TLB_REFILL
events.description: Attributable Level 2 data or unified TLB refill. This event counts refills for VA to PA translations only. The counter is not incremented on partial translations allocated in the main TLB and not incremented for IPA to VA translations. The core implements a unified TLB, therefore only L2_TLB_REFILL is incremented. This event counts only if stage 1 MMU is enabled

events.name: L2D_TLB
events.description: Attributable Level 2 data or unified TLB access. This event counts accesses to the main TLB caused by a correct requester and only if stage 1 MMU is enabled. The counter is incremented one time for each translation

events.name: L2I_TLB
events.description: Attributable Level 2 instruction TLB access. This event counts accesses to the main TLB caused by a correct requester and only if stage 1 MMU is enabled. The counter is incremented one time for each translation

events.name: DTLB_WALK
events.description: Data access to unified TLB that caused a page table walk. This event counts every access caused by each requester that does not hit in a VA to PA translation. The counter increments even if the translation generates a fault and only if stage 1 MMU is enabled

events.name: ITLB_WALK
events.description: Instruction access to unified TLB that caused a page table walk. This event counts every access caused by each requester that does not hit in a VA to PA translation. The counter increments even if the translation generates a fault and only if stage 1 MMU is enabled

events.name: LL_CACHE_RD
events.description: Last level cache access, read

events.name: LL_CACHE_MISS_RD
events.description: Last level cache miss, read

events.name: REMOTE_ACCESS_RD
events.description: Access to another socket in a multi-socket system, read

events.name: L1D_CACHE_RD
events.description: L1 data cache access, read. This event counts all read accesses, PLD, PF, TLB, and multiple cache accesses for the same load

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WR
events.description: L1 data cache access, write. This event counts all store lookups, reads, and writes into the cache

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WB_VICTIM
events.description: Level 1 data cache write-back, victim

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WB_CLEAN
events.description: Level 1 data cache write-back, cleaning and, coherency

events.name: L1D_CACHE_INVAL
events.description: Level 1 data cache invalidate

events.name: L2D_CACHE_RD
events.description: L2 data cache access, read. This event counts reads and prefetches. Snoop reads are excluded

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WR
events.description: L2 data cache access, write. This event counts L1 natural evictions, cache maintenance operations evictions, snoop evictions, and streams

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WB_VICTIM
events.description: L2 data cache write-back, victim

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WB_CLEAN
events.description: L2 data cache write-back, cleaning and coherency

events.name: L2D_CACHE_INVAL
events.description: L2 data cache invalidate

events.name: BUS_ACCESS_RD
events.description: Bus access read. This event counts beats of read data received from the SCU

events.name: BUS_ACCESS_WR
events.description: Bus access write. This event counts beats of store data sent to the SCU

events.name: MEM_ACCESS_RD
events.description: Data memory access, read

events.name: MEM_ACCESS_WR
events.description: Data memory access, write

events.name: UNALIGNED_LDST_SPEC
events.description: Unaligned access

events.name: LDREX_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, LDREX, or LDX

events.name: STREX_PASS_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX, or STX pass

events.name: STREX_FAIL_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX, or STX fail

events.name: STREX_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX, or STX

events.name: LD_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, load. This event counts all the instructions that go through the core rename block at each cycle, similar to INST_SPEC. The counter counts the last microoperation of each LDR instruction

events.name: ST_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, store. This event counts all the instructions that go through the core rename block at each cycle, similar to INST_SPEC. The counter counts the last microoperation of each STR instruction

events.name: LDST_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, load or store. This event counts all the instructions that go through the core rename block at each cycle, similar to INST_SPEC. The counter counts the last microoperation of each LDR or STR instruction

events.name: DP_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, integer data processing. This event counts all the instructions that go through the core rename block at each cycle, similar to INST_SPEC. The counter counts the last microoperation of each data processing instruction

events.name: ASE_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, Advanced SIMD instruction. This event counts all the instructions that go through the core rename block at each cycle, similar to INST_SPEC. The counter counts the last microoperation of each data engine SIMD instruction

events.name: VFP_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, floating-point instruction. This event counts all the instructions that go through the core rename block at each cycle, similar to INST_SPEC. The counter counts the last microoperation of each data engine floating-point instruction

events.name: CRYPTO_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, Cryptographic instruction. This event counts all the instructions that go through the core rename block at each cycle, similar to INST_SPEC. The counter counts the last microoperation of each data engine Cryptographic instruction

events.name: BR_INDIRECT_SPEC
events.description: Branch speculatively executed - Indirect branch

events.name: ISB_SPEC
events.description: Barrier speculatively executed, ISB. This event counts all architectural ISB instructions

events.name: DSB_SPEC
events.description: Barrier speculatively executed, DSB

events.name: DMB_SPEC
events.description: Barrier speculatively executed, DMB

events.name: EXC_UNDEF
events.description: Counts the number of UNDEFINED exceptions taken. This event is set every time that an UNDEF exception is executed. CCFAIL exceptions are excluded

events.name: EXC_HVC
events.description: Exception taken, Hypervisor Call. This event is set every time that an exception is executed because of an HVC instruction. CCFAIL exceptions are excluded. This event is not counted when it is accessible from Non-secure EL0 or EL1

events.name: L3D_CACHE_RD
events.description: Attributable Level 3 data or unified cache access, read. This event counts RDUnique, RDClean, RDNotSharedDirty, atomics (STR, LD, SWP, CMP reads and writes), and StashOnce sent to L3

events.name: L3D_CACHE_REFILL_RD
events.description: Attributable Level 3 data or unified cache refill, read

events.name: LF_STALL
events.description: A linefill caused an instruction side stall

events.name: PTW_STALL
events.description: A translation table walk caused an instruction side stall

events.name: I_TAG_RAM_RD
events.description: Number of ways read in the instruction cache - Tag RAM

events.name: I_DATA_RAM_RD
events.description: Number of ways read in the instruction cache - Data RAM

events.name: I_BTAC_RAM_RD
events.description: Number of ways read in the instruction BTAC RAM

events.name: D_LSU_SLOT_FULL
events.description: Duration for which all slots in the Load-Store Unit (LSU) are busy

events.name: LS_IQ_FULL
events.description: Duration for which all slots in the load-store issue queue are busy. This event counts the cycles where all slots in the LS IQs are full with micro-operations waiting for issuing, and the dispatch stage is not empty

events.name: DP_IQ_FULL
events.description: Duration for which all slots in the data processing issue queue are busy. This event counts the cycles where all slots in the DP0 and DP1 IQs are full with micro-operations waiting for issuing, and the despatch stage is not empty

events.name: DE_IQ_FULL
events.description: Duration for which all slots in the data engine issue queue are busy. This event is set every time that the data engine rename has at least one valid instruction, excluding No Operations (NOPs), that cannot move to the issue stage because accpt_instr is LOW

events.name: EXC_TRAP_HYP
events.description: Number of traps to hypervisor. This event counts the number of exception traps taken to EL2, excluding HVC instructions. This event is set every time that an exception is executed because of a decoded trap to the hypervisor. CCFAIL exceptions and traps caused by HVC instructions are excluded. This event is not counted when it is accessible from Non-secure EL0 or EL1

events.name: ETM_EXT_OUT0
events.description: ETM trace unit output 0

events.name: ETM_EXT_OUT1
events.description: ETM trace unit output 1

events.name: MMU_PTW
events.description: Duration of a translation table walk handled by the MMU

events.name: MMU_PTW_ST1
events.description: Duration of a Stage 1 translation table walk handled by the MMU. This event is not counted when it is accessible from Non-secure EL0 or EL1

events.name: MMU_PTW_ST2
events.description: Duration of a Stage 2 translation table walk handled by the MMU. This event is not counted when it is accessible from Non-secure EL0 or EL1

events.name: MMU_PTW_LSU
events.description: Duration of a translation table walk requested by the LSU

events.name: MMU_PTW_ISIDE
events.description: Duration of a translation table walk requested by the instruction side

events.name: MMU_PTW_PLD
events.description: Duration of a translation table walk requested by a Preload instruction or Prefetch request

events.name: MMU_PTW_CP15
events.description: Duration of a translation table walk requested by an address translation operation

events.name: L1PLD_TLB_REFILL
events.description: Level 1 PLD TLB refill

events.name: L2PLD_TLB
events.description: Level 2 preload and MMU prefetcher TLB access. This event only counts software and hardware prefetches at Level 2

events.name: UTLB_FLUSH
events.description: Level 1 TLB flush

events.name: TLB_ACCESS
events.description: Level 2 TLB access

events.name: L1PLD_TLB
events.description: Level 1 preload TLB access. This event only counts software and hardware prefetches at Level 1. This event counts all accesses to the preload data micro TLB, that is L1 prefetcher and preload instructions. This event does not take into account whether the MMU is enabled or not

events.name: PLDTLB_WALK
events.description: Prefetch access to unified TLB that caused a page table walk. This event counts software and hardware prefetches
